Tucson picks up the distress signal from the Ark, and realizes that Percept=
or had yet to be switched to a Maximal.  He radios quickly to Lord Elder.

=
"Lord Elder, the Ark is registering Perceptor as an enemy, I need time to h=
elp him attain the Maximal/Autobot signature so that way harm can be avoide=
d, over."

He stops just before getting to the Ark.  He knew that if he adv=
anced now, he could endanger his new found comrade and Talon as well.

In t=
he Ark, Rat Trap quickly mans the computer as his fingers tap feverishly on=
 the keyboard.

"Aww Slag, if we don't change Perceptor's signature Wheels =
will also be a gonner!  Lord Elder, I can do this, I've done it before!  Ju=
st say the word and it's done.  This is Rat Trap ta Wheels and Perceptor, O=
ver, better stay where you are for now, I know I can convert Perceptor's si=
gnature but I'm gonna need some time ta do that, and of course, permission =
ta access his signature files. Once that's done, it'll only take a few minu=
tes ta change it."

Tucson replies.

"Noted, I'll wait here.  Thank you Rat=
 Trap."

Quickstride takes some time to reflect the condition of Rodimus, t=
o the others.  He sighs.

" Well, judging by the way those insects drained =
his energy, he's gonna need one heck of a jump start after that.  And I dun=
no if this is true, just a hunch I'm gettn', but I think Tucson Prime's got=
 enough in his power core ta give Rodimus Prime the jump start he needs.  I=
 know that's what he'd wanna do.  All that power and strength..  He doesn't=
 wanna just keep that to himself, I fully believe that Tucson would rather =
save someone else than save himself. We saw that taday, when we were in tha=
t tunnel. He could've just left Rodimus down there, but he risked his spark=
 ta go back down and attempt a rescue.  And then when we were all leaving, =
he chose ta come up last, and waited until everyone else was safe. There's =
something inside him that is a little bit different than Optimus..  Just a =
little bit, not much. It's one of those things you can't put your finger on=
."

 As

is obviously were the minions had made their attack on the Ark several

nths ago. Only now was the scorched ground begining to heal as weeds
> and =
different wild grasses were begining to peak out from beneath the
> rocky g=
rounds.

 the Ark
> has not changed appreciatively since the last scans he had recie=
ved
> from it. A broken ship lying partial entoumbed in the side of a mid
>=
 sized mountain.
> 
> As Tuscon and those that were with him approached the=
 Ark the Ark
> computer voice could be heard, "Predacon signature detected.=
" The Ark
> shields snapped into place as the base went on alert and weapon=
s began
> to target Tuscon . . . or perhaps someone he's carrying.
